IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The School is committed to a rigourous college preparatory program, providing opportunities in academics, athletics, and extracurricular activities.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE LINSLY SCHOOL IS A PRIVATE, INDEPENDENT DAY AND BOARDING SCHOOL FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 5 THROUGH 12. THE COLLEGE PREPARATORY CRRICULUM THAT COMBINES THE TRADITIONAL VALUES OF HARD WORK, RESPECT, HONOR, HONESTY, AND SELF DISCIPLINE WITHIN A CHALLENGING ACADEMIC PROGRAM DESIGNED TO UNLOCK THE POTENTIAL OF EACH STUDENT.
IRS990.Desc: THE SCHOOL COLLECTS TUITION, ROOM, BOARD, AND OTHER FEES AND PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO FAMILIES IN NEED THROUGH FINANCIAL AID. EXPENSES DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM ARE SALARIES, TAXES AND BENEFITS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE SCHOOL BELIEVES THAT AN EDUCATION INCLUDES MUCH MORE THAN SCHOOL WORK AND OFFERS EXTRA CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES TO ALL STUDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE SCHOOL'S CAMPUS CONSISTS OF MULTIPLE BUILDINGS, ATHLETIC FIELDS AND HOUSING THAT SUPPORT THE SCHOOL'S MISSION.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE LINSLY SCHOOL CO GREG MARTIN

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School has adopted the policy of not capitalizing any collection items received or obtained for use in the Linsly Museum. No assets are recognized from the acquisition of collection items, which include uniforms, books, and other memorabilia. Generally, all additions to the Linsly Museum are obtained through donations and have no financial significance in relation to the operations of the School. Collection items are included in both in-kind contributions and in-kind goods and services reflected in the Statements of Activities.
INVESTMENT FEES NETTED AGAINST INVESTMENT INCOME -147,197. FINANCIAL AID NETTED AGAINST TUITION INCOME -5,256,900.
INVESTMENT FEES NETTED AGAINST INVESTMENT INCOME -147,197. FINANCIAL AID NETTED AGAINST TUITION INCOME -5,256,900.
THE LOCAL NEWSPAPERS AND NATIONAL MAGAZINE ADS INCLUDE STANDARD NONDISCRIMITORY DESCRIPTIONS
THE SCHOOL RECEIVED $157,879 OF GRANT REVENUE IN FY22 FROM THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIA. THE GRANTS WERE USED TO ASSIST WITH COVID RELATED EXPENDITURES AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: FINANCIAL AID FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING THE SCHOOL
